column3: No wait. You can call 409-795-2230 24/7 for current wait times and conditions.
TxDot vehicles and crews heading to Bolivar Peninsula for hurricane Harvey clean up. Thank you to all the crews for working so hard.
If you have questions about road closures please go to http://drivetexas.org it is updated with closures and estimated openings.
Yes
We are running today. Two boats in operation and minimal wait on both sides.
Ferry service is back operating normal. You should be able to get to Galveston. Stay safe.
You will have to check hwy conditions. I do not have that info.
There are no definite times. They try to leave on the hour and half hour.
What a beautiful sunset tonight. We are running two boats. There is no waiting on either side.
We plan to be running normal opeartions. 24/7. Multiple boats during the day and 1 boat at night.
We are operating as normal. Galveston to Bolivar and back.
We have two boats operating. One boat standing by. No wait on either side. Watch for clean up crews as they work to get debris cleared.
We are operating two boats with a third on standby.
We have 2 boats running and a third standing by. Stay safe.
We are operating this morning. Drive safe. Watch for water and debris on the roads. Stay safe.
We are operating this morning. See you soon.
Ferry sheltering in place now due to high winds. Will resume making runs once weather subsides.
Thank you so much.
Thanks for your kind words.
Cars too
You can call the tower to check but pls wait until the AM (409) 795-2230.
We are running as long as it is safe to do so. Our crew members are doing a great job. #Harvey

We have ferry crews ready to go but tide still too high to operate ferry. We are monitoring conditions and will resume when it is safe.
Thank you.
Weather conditions have dictated that ferry operations be suspended. Services will resume when safe to do so.
It is estimated that ferry services could be suspended as early as 6 pm today; however conditions will dictate when services are halted.
We are continuing to monitor conditions and making plans to adjust our trip schedule accordingly if needed. Right now we are still running.
Pls just follow the Twitter feed.
Still running. Using caution and may shelter in landing if needed till winds calm. Same as uf on hwy. Safety first.
We continue to monitor the weather. We always keep safety first.
